section.title: Introduction
section.p: Welcome to the Orbeon PresentationServer User Guide!

Orbeon PresentationServer (OPS) is an open source J2EE-based platform for XML-centric web applications. OPS is built around XHTML, XForms, XSLT, XML pipelines, and Web Services, which makes it ideal for applications that capture, process and present XML data.

Unlike other popular web application frameworks like Struts or WebWork that are based on Java objects and JSP, OPS is based on XML documents and XML technologies. This leads to an architecture better suited for the tasks of capturing, processing, and presenting information in XML format, and often does not require writing any Java code at all to implement your presentation layer.
OPS is built around Orbeon's optimized XPL engine, a mature, high-performance XML pipeline engine for processing XML data.

section.title: Purpose of the User Guide
section.p: The purpose of this guide is to get users acquainted with the fundamental concepts of PresentationServer: XML processors and XML pipelines, the XML Pipeline Definition Language (XPL), XForms, the Page Flow Controller (PFC), and PresentationServer's built-in XML processors. It is highly recommended to quickly get to the Tutorial to get started with developing applications with PresentationServer.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: This guide should be accessible to anyone with some experience developing simple Web applications.
